NOV 10, 2021
in
<span class="NewsItem-catList"><a href="https://maritimecampusantwerp.com/news?filter=campus" class="NewsItem-catItem">Campus</a></span></div><div class="NewsItem-title">
Building permit approval</div><div class="NewsItem-intro">
10-11-2021 Antwerp – The building permit for MCA (Maritime Campus Antwerp) has been approved for ± 40,000m². The do-campus will be the heart of innovation in the maritime sector. Demolition and clean up have already been completed. The works will start in the spring of 2022. The campus will open in 2024.</div></div></div><div class="NewsItem Grid-cell u-xs-sizeFull u-sm-sizeFull u-md-size1of2 u-size1of4"><a href="https://maritimecampusantwerp.com/news/plug-and-play-launches-maritime-innovation-platform-in-antwerp" class="NewsItem-link"></a><div class="NewsItem-content"><picture class="NewsItem-object"><source type="image/webp" srcset="https://maritimecampusantwerp.com/transforms/files/11743/PNP-Maritime-Visual_header_bcf8f44aad2d5b05a514f302020468c0.webp 554w, https://maritimecampusantwerp.com/transforms/files/11743/PNP-Maritime-Visual_header_5e9934e0155877b046e7beced708dd59.webp 360w" data-srcset="https://maritimecampusantwerp.com/transforms/files/11743/PNP-Maritime-Visual_header_bcf8f44aad2d5b05a514f302020468c0.webp 554w, https://maritimecampusantwerp.com/transforms/files/11743/PNP-Maritime-Visual_header_5e9934e0155877b046e7beced708dd59.webp 360w"><img class="NewsItem-image LazyLoaded" src="data:image/svg+xml;charset=utf-8,%3Csvg%20xmlns%3D%27http%3A%2F%2Fwww.w3.org%2F2000%2Fsvg%27%20width%3D%27554%27%20height%3D%27448%27%20style%3D%27background%3Atransparent%27%2F%3E" alt="PNP Maritime Visual header" data-sizes="100vw" data-srcset="https://maritimecampusantwerp.com/transforms/files/11743/PNP-Maritime-Visual_header_c4e5561f3b7499de879a2711a54811f5.jpeg 554w, https://maritimecampusantwerp.com/transforms/files/11743/PNP-Maritime-Visual_header_9ff2139d7826ab04ba2e40c2030fd2b4.jpeg 360w" sizes="100vw" srcset="https://maritimecampusantwerp.com/transforms/files/11743/PNP-Maritime-Visual_header_c4e5561f3b7499de879a2711a54811f5.jpeg 554w, https://maritimecampusantwerp.com/transforms/files/11743/PNP-Maritime-Visual_header_9ff2139d7826ab04ba2e40c2030fd2b4.jpeg 360w"></picture><div class="NewsItem-date">

Plug and Play Launches Maritime Innovation Platform in Antwerp, Belgium</div><div class="NewsItem-intro">
ANTWERP, Belgium, April 22, 2021 – Global innovation platform, Plug and Play, together with Founding Partners City of Antwerp, CMB, DXC Technology, Euronav, and Port of Antwerp, has announced the launch of their first maritime program in Antwerp, Belgium. The purpose of the program is to connect international startups with the Founding Partners to pilot their technologies and drive the future of maritime as world-class leaders of R&amp;amp;D and innovation.</div></div></div><div class="NewsItem Grid-cell u-xs-sizeFull u-sm-sizeFull u-md-size1of2 u-size1of3"><a href="https://maritimecampusantwerp.com/news/true-or-false" class="Info-content"><h2 class="Info-titleHeader">
What MCA stands for</h2><div class="Info-text"><p>MCA is a "do" campus and a community where business, technology and knowledge are linked to strengthen and further develop the maritime sector. MCA houses companies ranging from larger corporate companies to the smallest start-ups, educational and research institutions to collaborate and innovate.</p></div><div class="Info-gridContainer"><div class="Info-item"><div class="Info-svgContainer"><svg class="Info-icon" width="51" height="51" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 51 51"><image id="kkrmzzkzcb-Community" width="51" height="51" xlink:href="data:image/png;base64,"></image></svg></div><div class="Info-title">
Community</div></div><div class="Info-item"><div class="Info-svgContainer"><svg class="Info-icon" width="51" height="51" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 51 51"><image id="uloaeskujh-Campus" width="51" height="51" xlink:href="data:image/png;base64,"></image></svg></div><div class="Info-title">
Campus</div></div><div class="Info-item"><div class="Info-svgContainer"><svg class="Info-icon" width="51" height="51" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 61 61"><image id="pqvlkpnitn-Technology_innovation" data-name="Technology &amp; innovation" width="61" height="61" xlink:href="data:image/png;base64,"></image></svg></div><div class="Info-title">

Completion remediation MCA Campus</div></div><div class="Grid-cell Timeline-right u-xs-sizeFull u-sm-sizeFull u-md-sizeFull u-size7of12 loaded"><div class="Timeline-intro"></div></div></div></div><div class="Timeline "><div class="Timeline-fadeOut "></div><div class="Grid  Grid--inf"><div class="circle"></div><div class="Grid-cell Timeline-left u-xs-sizeFull u-sm-sizeFull u-md-sizeFull u-size5of12"><div class="Timeline-date">
NOV 10, 2021</div><div class="Timeline-title">
Building permit approval</div></div><div class="Grid-cell Timeline-right u-xs-sizeFull u-sm-sizeFull u-md-sizeFull u-size7of12 loaded"><div class="Timeline-intro"><p><strong>10</strong><strong>-11-2021 Antwerp – The building permit for MCA (Maritime Campus Antwerp) has been approved for ± 40,000m². The do-campus will be the heart of innovation in the maritime sector. Demolition and clean up have already been completed. The works will start in the spring of 2022. The campus will open in 2024. </strong></p></div><div class="Content"><div class="Text "><p>MCA wishes to bring maritime actors together. It will be a do-campus with room for the core activities of larger corporate companies, start-ups, education and research institutions to work together and innovate. The ambition is to strengthen the maritime sector and make it more sustainable.</p></div><div class="Media"><a href="https://maritimecampusantwerp.com/uploads/files/MCA-Corridor_2021-11-10-142058.jpg" 108.9 374.6 159.661z" transform="translate(164.237 129.759)"></path></g></svg><div class="Quote-textContainer"><div class="Quote-text"><p>"The maritime sector needs a location where all players can meet and work together to tackle the challenges of shipping. Decarbonising our industry is one of them, and Antwerp and MCA can play a crucial role in this. MCA is ideally situated in Blue Gate, the former Petroleum South cluster. In the same place where fossil fuels created prosperity in the 19th and 20th centuries, we now wish to use innovation, technology and sustainability to build tomorrow's prosperity."</p></div><div class="Quote-refference"><span class="Quote-Name">Alexander Saverys - </span><span class="Quote-company">CEO CMB</span></div></div></div></div><div class="Text "><p>It concerns the former BP site that in the meantime has been completely cleaned up. MCA transforms an old industrial area into a future-orientated, maritime and innovative site with respect for a balance between economic activity and nature. The building has room for co-working and co-creation, labs, workshops, extensive R&amp;D facilities, educational facilities and the necessary support services. The R&amp;D halls will already be used, for example, to test hydrogen engines and build hydrogen applications.</p></div><div class="Media"><a In addition, we will soon launch the official start of the MCA Community.
